Package me.wobblyyyy.edt

Class FrozenArray<E>

  • java.lang.Object
    • me.wobblyyyy.edt.FrozenArray<E>
  • Type Parameters:
    E - the type of elements that the array should contain.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    Arrayable<E>
    public class FrozenArray<E>
extends java.lang.Object
implements Arrayable<E>
    A "frozen" array. Once this array is created, it can't be modified in any way, shape, nor form. Or array element. The intention behind this class is to provide a way to use unmodifiable arrays to ensure that arrays are used effectively in situations where there's no need to utilize setting array values.

    This type of array won't actually improve performance or anything. The array set methods don't take up any CPU cycles if they're not used. Rather, this type of array serves mostly as a way to enforce that nobody modifies the contents of an array at any point. In a situation where a single array is being passed... everywhere, basically, it can be confusing to keep track of who modifies what. Whenever this array shouldn't be modified at all by anything, as clean code shouldn't be confusing, it can't be modified. Yay!

    Author:
    Colin Robertson

    • Field Detail

      • array

        private final java.lang.Object[] array
        The internal array. This array is final - there's no need to change the size of it, etc. Because it's frozen, it isn't changed after its construction.

        private final ArrayIterator<E> _itr_internal_

    • Constructor Detail

      • FrozenArray

        public FrozenArray​(int size)
        Create a new frozen array.
        Parameters:
        size - how large the array should be.

      • FrozenArray

        @SafeVarargs
public FrozenArray​(E... elements)
        Create a new frozen array.
        Parameters:
        elements - the array that the frozen array should use. This array WILL NOT be copied. Remember, arrays are MUTABLE objects, meaning that any reference to them returns the same object. If you create a frozen array WITHOUT copying the array, the array you passed to this constructor will be the frozen array's array - modifying the array via the methods in this class will modify that array as well.

      • FrozenArray

        public FrozenArray​(Arrayable<E> arrayable)
        Create a new FrozenArray instance by using an Arrayable object to get the newly-created frozen array's contents.
        Parameters:
        arrayable - the array object that should be the base of the new dynamic array. Ex: FrozenArray instance.
